biotools.summary: This is the web version of the Multiple alignment Manipulator (MaM), which takes a multiple alignment of genomic sequences as input and calculates the locations of exons, common repeat elements and unique regions based on user-selected programs/information. The graphical display also allows users to focus an assessment of sequence variation on the identified regions.

bioschemas.name: WebMAM
bioschemas.summary: This is the web version of the Multiple alignment Manipulator (MaM), which takes a multiple alignment of genomic sequences as input and calculates the locations of exons, common repeat elements and unique regions based on user-selected programs/information. The graphical display also allows users to focus an assessment of sequence variation on the identified regions.
